ResourceHeader.Description: This data set, created in 2010 by Nand Lal, contains 30-min resolution fluxes and count rates of energetic protons, alpha particles, electrons and X-rays from the E7 experiment (P.I.: J. Trainor, GSFC) flown on the Helios 1 spacecraft. Accompanying each flux and count rate is a statistical uncertainty of the flux or rate. The data are spin-averaged. The data are in 920-character ASCII records and consist of: A. Proton fluxes based on pulse height and rate data in 7 energy windows, 3.40-6.05, 6.05-11.10, 11.10-21.60, 24.52-28.82, 32.00-46.30, 45.30-57.22, 135.2-206.5 MeV. B. Alpha particle fluxes based on pulse heights and count rates in 6 energy windows, 3.20-4.98, 4.98-11.50, 11.50-21.60, 24.51-31.12, 31.12-45.53, 45.53-57.53 MeV/n. C. Combined proton plus alpha particle fluxes based on LET1 and HET count rates in 6 energy windows, 3-6, 6-11, 11-21, 20-30, 32-45, 45-56 MeV/n. D. Alpha particle fluxes based on HET count rates in three energy windows, 20-30, 32-45, 45-57 MeV/n. E. Two count rates primarily due to electrons at 2-4 and 4-8 MeV. F. 21 additional count rates corresponding to individual telescope sensors or sensor combinations. For one sensor, rates at each of several discrimination levels are given). These rates are further discussed in the documentation and in the references provided. A subset of the above parameters (A, B, E) are available with graphical display at the OMNIWeb-Plus interface identified below
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: The late Dr. James H. Trainor and Dr. Nand Lal

InformationURL.Name: Helios 1 E7 Readme
InformationURL.Description: Listing of parameters in data records

AccessURL.Name: OMNIWeb-Plus
AccessURL.Description: Primary parameters of data product, with graphical display

AccessURL.Name: Multi-Source Spectral Plot
AccessURL.Description: Spectral plots and power law fits for arbitrary durations

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: The late Dr. James H. Trainor and Dr. Nand Lal, plus GSFC's Space Physics Data Facility

Parameter.Name: Proton fluxes and uncertainties
Parameter.Description: Proton fluxes and associated statistical uncertainties for the seven energy ranges 3.40-6.05, 6.05-11.10, 11.10-21.60, 24.52-28.82, 32.00-46.30, 45.30-57.22, 135.2-206.5 MeV. The fluxes are obtained by combining pulse height and count rate data.

Structure.Description: Seven rows of pairs of proton flux and statistical uncertainty in the flux. The rows correspond to the seven energy ranges given above.

Parameter.Name: Alpha particle fluxes and uncertainties
Parameter.Description: Alpha particle fluxes and associated statistical uncertainties for the six energy ranges 3.20-4.98, 4.98-11.50, 11.50-21.60, 24.51-31.12, 31.12-45.53, 45.53-57.53 MeV/n. The fluxes are obtained by combining pulse height and count rate data.

Structure.Description: Six rows of pairs of alpha particle flux and statistical uncertainty in the flux. The rows correspond to the six energy ranges given above.

Parameter.Name: Combined proton and alpha particle fluxes and uncertainties
Parameter.Description: Fluxes for mixed protons and alpha particles, and associated statistical uncertainties, for the six energy ranges 3-6, 6-11, 11-21, 20-30, 32-45, 45-56 MeV/n. The fluxes are based on count rates only, without any pulse height analysis.

Structure.Description: Six rows of pairs of proton flux and statistical uncertainty in the flux. The rows correspond to the six energy ranges given above.

Parameter.Name: Alpha particle fluxes and uncertainties without PHA
Parameter.Description: Fluxes of alpha particles and associated statistical uncertainties, for the three energy ranges 20-30, 32-45, 45-57 MeV/n. The fluxes are based on count rates only, without any pulse height analysis.

Structure.Description: Three rows of pairs of alpha particle flux and statistical uncertainty in the flux. The rows correspond to the three energy ranges given above.

Parameter.Name: Electron count rates and uncertainties
Parameter.Description: Count rates primarily due to electrons, and associated statistical uncertainties, for the two energy ranges 2-4 and 4-8 MeV.

Structure.Description: Two rows of pairs of electron count rate and statistical uncertainty in the rate. The rows correspond to the 2-4 and 4-8 MeV energy ranges.

Parameter.Name: Miscellaneous additional count rates and uncertainties
Parameter.Description: 21 additional count rates corresponding to individual telescope sensors or sensor combinations. For one sensor, rates at each of several discrimination levels are given). These rates are further discussed in the documentation and in the references provided. They are not likely to be widely useful

Structure.Description: 21 rows of pairs of various count rate and statistical uncertainty in the rate.
